New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first MLB player to reach a 47-47 season with 47 home runs and 47 stolen bases.
Ohtani surpassed his previous career high of 46 home runs set in 2021.
He matched and surpassed Alex Rodriguez's 42-42 season record.
Ohtani's 40th home run was a walk-off grand slam.
Key Match Events: Ohtani hit his 47th home run and 48th stolen base in the same game.
The Dodgers responded to a Cubs rally with a series of home runs by Ohtani, Tommy Edman, Will Smith, and Max Muncy.
The game was won by the Dodgers 10-8, with Edman contributing two home runs.
Ohtani's performance included a walk and a steal, marking the 12th time he had both HR and SB in a game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ohtani is on pace for 52 home runs and 53 stolen bases by the end of the season.
His 40-40 achievement in August was the earliest for any player, with a walk-off grand slam.
Ohtani's 47-47 season is a milestone in uncharted territory, joining an elite group of players.
